mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'Actions speak louder than words' imply?

options.a: Speaking is more effective than taking action
options.b: What someone does has a stronger impact than what they say they will do
options.c: Loud voices can drown out any action
options.d: Words are more powerful when spoken loudly

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'Actions speak louder than words' implies that what someone actually does is more significant than what they claim they will do.
